latest.title: Result of 2022 AGM
latest.content:
9 Dec 2022 14:52
RNS Number : 2686J
Boston International Holdings PLC
09 December 2022
9 December 2022
BOSTON INTERNATIONAL HOLDINGS PLC
(
"
BIH
" or the "
Company
"
)
Result of 2022 Annual General Meeting
The Board of Directors of BIH announces that at the 2022 Annual General Meeting of the Company (the "
2022 AGM
") held earlier today, all resolutions put to shareholders of the Company (being 6 ordinary resolutions and 2 special resolutions) were duly passed.
The resolutions included resolution no. 7 (ordinary resolution) approving the buy-back of all the
112,219,843 non-voting
the deferred shares of 0.9 pence each in the Company in issue (the "
Deferred Shares
") and that buy-back was therefore completed immediately following the conclusion of the 2022 AGM and all the Deferred Shares were thereupon cancelled.
The full text of the resolutions can be found in the Notice of the 2022 AGM set out at the end of the Circular to shareholders dated 16 November 2022 in relation to the 2022 AGM, a copy of which is available on the Company's website at
https://www.bihplc.com/shareholder-information/circulars
.
In addition, pursuant to the FCA's Listing Rule 14.3.6R, a copy of the shareholder resolution passed at the 2022 AGM approving the buy-back of all the Deferred Shares (being the only resolution that did not concern 'ordinary business' at the 2022 AGM) has been submitted to the National Storage Mechanism and will be available shortly at
https://data.fca.org.uk/#/nsm/nationalstoragemechanism
.
Total voting rights
Following the buy-back of all the Deferred Shares (none of which had any voting rights), the Company's issued share capital consists of 112,219,943 ordinary shares of 0.1 pence, each with one voting right. The Company does not hold any ordinary shares in treasury. Therefore, the total number of voting rights in the Company is still 112,219,943.
For more information, please contact:-
Boston International Holdings Plc
Christopher Pitman, Chairman
+44 (0) 7768 104329
Peterhouse Capital Limited (Broker)
Lucy Williams / Duncan Vasey / Eran Zucker
+44 (0) 20 7469 0930
This information is provided by RNS, the news service of the London Stock Exchange. RNS is approved by the Financial Conduct Authority to act as a Primary Information Provider in the United Kingdom. latest.title: Appointment of New Director
latest.content:
9 Apr 2025 09:30
RNS Number : 3064E
Boston International Holdings PLC
09 April 2025
For immediate release
9 April 2025
BOSTON INTERNATIONAL HOLDINGS PLC
("
BIH
" or the "
Company
")
Appointment of New Director
The Board of directors of BIH
is pleased to announce that
Abdulmunim (Abdul) Sultan Said Bin Brek (aged 64) has been appointed as a Director of the Company with effect from today as a nominee for Zarara Energy Limited ("
ZEL
"), the Company's majority shareholder (following the resignation of Brock Tuppeny as a Director of the Company and nominee of ZEL, as announced by the Company on 4 February 2025)
.
Abdulmunim Bin Brek graduated in 1986 with a BSc. in Geology and Physics from the United Arab Emirates University, Al Ain. In 1987 he joined Dubai Aluminium (DUBAL) as a graduate trainee in Carbon Plant and worked in various areas of Smelter Operation and by 2001 he was promoted to a position of General Manager Smelter Operation. In 2013, DUBAL and EMAL were merged to form EGA (Emirates Global Aluminium) and following the merger he was appointed to the position of SVP Shared Technical Services and from 2021 to the end of 2022 he was Advisor - Midstream.
Abdulmunim Bin Brek is currently a founder and a director of a management consultancy business and a corporate solutions business both based in the UAE.
There are no disclosures to be made under UK Listing Rule 6.4.8R in respect of Abdul Bin Brek and ne does not own any shares in the Company.
For more information, please contact:-
Boston International Holdings Plc
Christopher Pitman, Chairman
+44 (0) 7768 104329
This information is provided by RNS, the news service of the London Stock Exchange. RNS is approved by the Financial Conduct Authority to act as a Primary Information Provider in the United Kingdom. latest.title: Annual Financial Report and Suspension Update
latest.content:
6 Jun 2025 13:40
RNS Number : 8546L
Boston International Holdings PLC
06 June 2025
The information contained within this announcement is deemed by the Company to constitute inside information for the purposes of Article 7 of EU Regulation 596/2014 (which forms part of domestic UK law pursuant to the European Union (Withdrawal) Act 2018) ("UK MAR"). Upon the publication of this announcement via a Regulatory Information Service, this information is considered to be in the public domain.
For immediate release
6 June 2025
BOSTON INTERNATIONAL HOLDINGS PLC
("
BIH
" or the "
Company
")
Publication of Annual Report & Audited Accounts for the year ended 31 December 2024
Lifting of Temporary Suspension of Listing and Trading in the Company's Shares
The
board of directors of BIH
is pleased to announce that its annual report and audited accounts for the year ended 31 December 2024 (the "
2024 Annual Report & Accounts
") have now been finalised and published. A copy of the 2024 Annual Report & Accounts will be shortly available on the Company's website at:
https://www.bihplc.com/shareholder-information/financial-reports
and will also be soon available for viewing at the National Storage Mechanism:
https://data.fca.org.uk/#/nsm/nationalstoragemechanism
.
Application will be made to the Financial Conduct Authority (the "
FCA
") for the lifting of the temporary suspension of the listing of the Company's shares on the FCA's Official List which was put into place on 1 May 2025. The Company's re-listing will take effect on receipt of approval from the FCA.
For more information, please contact:-
Boston International Holdings Plc
Christopher Pitman, Chairman
+44 (0) 7768 104329
This information is provided by RNS, the news service of the London Stock Exchange. RNS is approved by the Financial Conduct Authority to act as a Primary Information Provider in the United Kingdom. Terms and conditions relating to the use and distribution of this information may apply. For further information, please contact
